definition: to go down/to descend/to go on/to continue/(of a servant) to withdraw
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: At last the rebellion was crushed down.
I would have carried him to the deepest part and dropped him in it.
sentences.chinese: 我會把他背到最深的地方然後把他丟下去。

sentences.english: I felt it useless for us to say anything further.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我們再說下去也沒有用。

sentences.english: The water gurgled as it ran down the plug-hole.
sentences.chinese: 水汨汨地從塞孔中流下去。

sentences.english: If love told me walked to down I'll spell to love go end.
sentences.chinese: 如果愛告訴我走下去我會拼到愛盡頭。

sentences.english: However, due to excessive blood loss, he finally can not support.
sentences.chinese: 但是由於失血過多，他終於支撐不下去了。

sentences.english: She keeps after her boyfriend all day long and he can't bear it any more.
sentences.chinese: 她整天都在與她的男朋友爭吵，他沒法再忍受下去了。

sentences.english: He thought of here, go down the windows fly.
sentences.chinese: 他想到這兒，順着窗戶飛了下去。

sentences.english: After a few days, so a lot oh, grow out smallpox in India.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾天，好了很多哦，痘印淡下去了。

sentences.english: My heart sinks and quickly pull to the side.
sentences.chinese: 我的心咯噔一下沉了下去。

sentences.english: Take the medicine down and do not stop to think about it.
sentences.chinese: 把藥吞下去，吞的時候不要停下來想它。
我們看着那艘船沉下去。

sentences.english: If you carry on , ond day something good will happen .
sentences.chinese: 如果你堅持下去，總有一天會有好事情發生。

sentences.english: A. silver crescent moon set slowly below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一鉤銀月慢慢從地平線上落下去。

sentences.english: Because we must keep the search for knowledge going.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們必須將對知識的探索繼續下去。

sentences.english: The swamp country is inclined to poach in winter.
sentences.chinese: 這片沼澤地帶在冬季一踏就陷下去。

definition: to come down/(completed action marker)/(after verb of motion, indicates motion down and towards us, also fig.)/(indicates continuation from the past towards us)/to be harvested (of crops)/to be over (of a period of time)/to go among the masses (said of leaders)
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
won't do/be out of the question/be no good/not work/not be capable
to come up/to approach/(verb complement indicating success)
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
